bow: mother opinions on testicle checks am reposting this into this subreddit in hopes of potentially finding some responders it was difficult to write and would really appreciate some feedback this is something that is rather difficult for me to talk about but am really hoping that the women of reddit will be willing to discuss this topic with me and figure it anonymous so it really the only way would ever feel comfortable talking about this subject am doubly interested in the opinions of women who are also mothers or interested in being mothers especially any mothers that may have gone through something similar with their young boys well do want to get too graphic unless there is some interest shown and people feel the details are necessary for more context but basically had very very uncomfortable relationship with testicle checks as young boy felt extremely private was very shy and on top of that my testicles are extremely sensitive but there is nothing explicitly wrong with them apparently except they have an slightly higher concentration of nerves than your average male any time doctor would bring it up or my mother would bolt out of the doctor office and literally run mile away or just refuse to go to the doctor altogether for the most part my mother was understanding but not in very kind way would be harshly punished and yelled at usually but at least she would end up signing me out of the exams well until one day she decided that it was time to be firm guess she actually went through the trouble of hiring someone to help her escort me to the doctor office and keep me there and well had to have my first testicle check while being held down for it after this guess my mom was satisfied that at least had relatively normal equipment and did really want to subject me to anymore of it and it did come up too much few times she would ask if was willing to have another one but was too freaked out to even consider it but few years later she felt enough time had gone by was older etc and decided to take firm stance again both of these were some of the worst days of my life the experiences were so horrible have never been able to fully comprehend them or how mother could stand there and watch her son go through something like that really want to know if other mother have had to do anything like this is it relatively common or is this just an insane case of misfortune articles blogs like this one make me think it might be somewhat common http open salon com content php cid=43950 would really like to know about mother perspectives on it and whether you would have done essentially the same thing as my mother or not was it something essential or not guess am just searching for some perspective opinions from the other side of the equation it taken long time to even get the point of talking about it anonymously on the internet hah for age references was about the first time and about 12 the second time really appreciate anyone daring to offer their opinion up it an awkward subject but very real one to me thank you very much how old are you now it sounds like you are still very young since you have come to terms with the fact that it is medical necessity sure they like doing it less than you like having it done it most definitely hurt your mother more than it hurt you what you need to come to terms with is the fact that everyone has to go through uncomfortable and awkward physical assessments for the sake of their health sure every woman out there would trade pap smear for cup cough check tl dr you have some growing up to do what she said in fact you better get really used to it because testicles check is nothing compared to prostate exam if im guessing just think about it this way everyone goes through it you re not special have no doubt that your experiences were intense emotionally the way you made it sound was that your private anatomy was never discussed or brought up unless it was in the type of situation where you were supposed to submit to some other person checking for problems right off the bat if you are raised to be comfortable with your body and to understand that there is nothing bad about on your body it easy to see why having testicle check would feel humiliating terrifying and even leave you feeling violated it sounds as though your mother had hard time of sticking to her guns until things absolutely had to be done that parenting habit tends to cause real problems not only for the parent themselves but for the child as well as you experienced when she later refused to give in consistency is one of the biggest rules of parenting and by failing to uphold it you were unable to prepare yourself mentally for the exam you be required to sit through which probably led to the trauma that you ve carried with you all of these years obviously there not much your mother can do about these instances now but apologize for not being able to help you with your feelings and fears associated with the testicle checks but your negative experiences could prove to help you be better parent if you choose to have children in your lifetime kids may be young but they re not stupid often sitting them down and talking with them about things like their body upcoming doctor visits even daily experiences can help them develop the resources to understand why something like testicle check may be necessary it does mean that they wo be nervous embarrassed or afraid but it could help them come to terms with their discomfort by understanding their body and what will happen through their discussions with you you ca lie to kids about procedures and expect them to willingly go to every doctor visit just like you ca cave all but one time and then expect them to trust what you say or respect your authority as parent the unexpected turn of events often leaves children feeling betrayed and vulnerable if you were to ask me directly say that your mother was unintentionally responsible for the severely negative experience you had with testicle checks as child and that you have that much more knowledge empowering you to improve as parent where she fell short it not that am unable to recognize it as medically important but do see why it is so important that it ca be skipped until you are older do see why it is something that ca just be left up to the kid when he is 18 of his own free will why does it have to be forced at least in cases of severe sensitivity like mine do you really think it was harder for my mother than for me ve actually been able to somewhat move past it funnily enough because of some other medical issues have had to get prostate exam despite being pretty young still the prostate exam was nothing compared to those testicle checks had to go through not even close guess what am asking really is was it actually important enough for my mother to hold me down for first really appreciate your taking the time to reply know this is the easiest thing to discuss it means lot to me what makes you say medical necessity over simply medically important mean is it really warranted for mother to effectively restraint her son in such situations am really looking more for perspectives to understand the whole situation more than anything guess see my other comment about the fact that despite being young ve had to get prostate exams but when was older and could get something like that done of my own free will and fully understood all of the medical reasons well to be fair mine were potentially very serious it seemed like an entirely different situation why ca testicle checks just be left until you are 18 and able to make your own free decision for reference only 19 now first really appreciate your taking the time to reply know this is the easiest thing to discuss it means lot to me was raised to pretty much believe that sex is evil and that private parts are never to be shown to anyone are dirty etc that was definitely part of the problem the other part was just that am very shy and literally physically very sensitive just to be clear do exactly hold huge grudge or anything against my mom realize parents are as human as their kids am just at point where feel could greatly benefit from learning perspectives from other mothers women in general although sometimes am surprised myself that it did affect my relationship with my mother more guess for certain amount of time it must have though the experiences pretty much turned me off the idea of having kids would most likely not force my kids to have such exams and would end up being hauled to jail guess since everyone else is saying how forcing kids into these things is routine and necessary doctors do just make things up they need to check you as you develop and catch problems early it not conspiracy to make you do something you do want to your mom did the right thing hope you can see that and take better care of yourself as it is now your responsibility there are no exceptions it needed to be done despite my special case of extreme sensitivity surprised your mother signed you out of the exams would have never done that because it is very important for little boys to get their testicles checked regularly your mom just wanted to make sure you were healthy nothing mean about that…your sensitivity does really matter there are no exceptions you just needed to get your testicles checked really do mothers not feel bad about just standing there and making their little boys go through torture like that though well do know but they should feel bad about it why not getting your testicles checked is not the worst thing ever just simple exam but very important they seem like the worst things in the world to me since am especially sensitive pretty much any other exam seems better to me as mothers we have to do lot of really not fun things to make sure our kids are healthy if you were my kid probably would have talked to you about it ahead of time and let you know that it was absolutely going to be done also would have spoken to the dr to see if there was anything they could do to make you more comfortable really do think your mother handled it well at all it absurd to excuse child from an exam but then punish him for not going when my daughter was 18 months old she was diagnosed with advanced lyme disease for an entire year had to take her to specialist and get bloodwork done every time the first time they did the testing was in an er they could find vein and had to physically hold down my screaming toddler for 45 minutes while they poked and poked it brings tears to my eyes to even think about it now but she happy healthy yr old luckily the specialist was much better at it then the er was my son just had an infection under his foreskin so got to give him the same treatment while it was being cleaned hated every second of it but we do what we need to testicle exams are an un fun fact of life for men but your mom did you disservice by not preparing you for it and letting you think they re optional now if you want to talk about the necessity of them ask your doctor maybe he can shed some light on why they re so important wow well the wrong impression was definitely given because had always thought they were optional and she just decided to do it anyway would you have given your son the same treatment for testicle check if he did cooperate or is holding down reserved for more important things ve had to hold my kids down for well checks and vaccines when they were infants toddlers but not anymore if my kid was really nervous about an upcoming exam would make him an appointment to see his regular dr talk about what to expect and let him her ask any questions would tell my kid before hand we ll listen to what the dr says needs to be done and if it has to be done then we ll make you as comfortable as possible and if he still fought me on it then yes hold him down remember being really nervous about my first lady dr appointment so my mom took me shopping for fancy underwear and tried to explain what would happen beforehand think open communication goes really long way if your dr and your mom had talked to you explained why it was important let you ask questions and done everything they could to make you more comfortable would that have been easier for you to handle well to be honest probably not had it somewhat explained to me basically knew what wold happen the reason fought ran was because of how sensitive my testicles are not because just did want to cooperate so really am not sure there was anything that could ve been done to convince me when was young how would you have really explained it though also how old were you for your first lady dr appointment assumed those happened when girls were pretty old almost 18 ve had to hold my daughter down for shots that were important for her health she hated it and she cried but she got over it ve had to hold her down for measurements too to make sure she growing at the appropriate rate etc it never fun thing to need to do but it important would do the same thing your mother did if it meant making sure my child was healthy do you feel bad having to hold them down or is it just routine part of the exam it does always happened around 18 had my first examination down there when was 15 due some issues it was terrible did want to do it but my parents and doctors needed me to do it hardly remember it being terrible once it was finished those types of examinations are fun for anyone but people do them all preteens he hated but it was better than not checking it and having to get surgery later on same goes with athletic physicals when he was teen they cupped and felt around or else he could play hmm but 15 is still twice the age of remember coming very close to being cornered into doing one of those sports physicals it was one of the most awful moments ever when they told me testicle check was part took me to the doctor some time later and made me get checked do you think that was the right thing to do yes do think it was the right thing to do at or even 15 you are in position to decide what is best for you medically at least that is my opinion there might be medical reason your testicles are so sensitive to find out why doctor would have to examine you would make my son undergo the tests necessary for his health most children mine included move on rather quickly for any ordeal and am there the whole time am sure your mom did what she thought was best for you to be healthy this procedures are fairly common and preformed for reason is there reason why this still bothers you have you spoken to doctor or maybe therapist there could be more at the heart of the issue maybe feel sensitive am and then it somehow got reinforced again because thought it would never have to happen again but it did maybe it ll bother me less in time to know that other mother would have done the
